features.name: Direct Google OAuth Authentication
features.description: Google OAuth integration using @react-oauth/google library with ID token flow. Backend verifies tokens using google-auth library and creates/retrieves users from Turso database.

features.name: Turso Database Integration
features.description: SQLite database via Turso (libsql) with user_roles, user_preferences, and activity_log tables. Automatic first-user admin assignment implemented in database layer.

features.name: First User Admin Assignment
features.description: Automatic admin role assignment for the first user to register. Implemented in create_user function by counting existing users.

features.name: Google ID Token Verification
features.description: Backend middleware that verifies Google ID tokens using google.oauth2.id_token. Validates tokens against Google OAuth Client ID and rejects invalid/expired tokens with 401.

features.name: Role-Based Access Control
features.description: Role-based authorization with require_role decorator supporting user, sqa, and admin roles from Turso database.

features.name: Protected Routes
features.description: Frontend route protection that redirects unauthenticated users to login page.

features.name: User Preferences Management
features.description: User preferences stored in Turso including theme (light/dark/system), email notifications, and discord notifications with API endpoints for updates.

features.name: Theme System
features.description: Dark mode and light mode theme support with system preference detection stored in Turso user_preferences.

features.name: Dashboard
features.description: Main dashboard with backend health monitoring, user welcome message, and quick action buttons for bugs and tasks.

features.name: Navigation Bar
features.description: Responsive navigation with theme toggle, user profile display, and sign out functionality.

features.name: Main Layout
features.description: Application layout wrapper with navigation bar and content area.

features.name: Error Handling
features.description: React error boundaries and loading components for async operations.

features.name: API Client
features.description: Centralized API client for authenticated requests with Google ID token in Authorization header.

features.name: User Management API
features.description: REST API endpoints for user authentication, profile retrieval, preferences updates, and admin user management.

features.name: Activity Logging
features.description: User activity tracking in Turso activity_log table for audit trail of logins, logouts, and preference changes.

features.name: Health Check API
features.description: Backend health monitoring endpoint to verify API availability.

features.name: Issue List View
features.description: Filterable, searchable list of Jira issues with pagination. Supports desktop table and mobile card views with URL query param sync for shareable filters.

features.name: Debounced Search
features.description: Search input with 300ms debounce to filter issues via API call, reducing unnecessary requests.

features.name: Issue Detail View
features.description: Two-column detail page showing issue description with markdown rendering, comments, and activity timeline. Auto-refreshes every 30 seconds when tab is visible.

features.name: Comments and Collaboration
features.description: Comment list displaying issue comments with 'via Relay' or 'via Jira' badges, plus comment form with Cmd+Enter submit.

features.name: Activity Timeline
features.description: Visual timeline showing issue history including status changes, assignments, and other updates.

features.name: Status and Priority Editing
features.description: Role-based dropdown controls for editing issue status and priority. Only visible to sqa and admin roles, enforcing role-based access.

features.name: Jira Cloud Integration
features.description: Backend service layer for Jira Cloud REST API v3 with SQA template transformation and retry logic.

features.name: SPA Navigation
features.description: Simple pathname-based routing without react-router, using window.history.pushState and popstate events.
